SectionFour.title: A History Of Passion
SectionFour.p1: Founded in 1969 by racing driver Henri Julien, Automobiles Gonfaronnaises Sportives (AGS) is a motor racing institution, having competed in the Formula 1 World Championship alongside the likes of Gabriele Tarquini, Yannick Dalmas and Philippe Streiff.
SectionFour.p2: Building on its heritage, AGS is now committed to supporting future drivers and sharing its passion with all those who dream of discovering motor racing.

CorporateEvents.title: Events & Companies
CorporateEvents.subtitle: Our solutions for professionals
CorporateEvents.p1: Offer your staff or clients an unforgettable driving experience, perfectly tailored to their wishes and needs. We'll take care of the entire organisation of your corporate event, guaranteeing you a tailor-made experience.
CorporateEvents.p2: Take advantage of our top-of-the-range facilities: changing rooms, showers, briefing rooms, professional simulator, reception room, visit to the workshop, as well as exclusive privatisation of the circuit with direct access to the track and even the possibility of arriving by helicopter. If you wish, we can also take care of booking transport, accommodation, catering and many other logistical aspects to facilitate your event.
CorporateEvents.p3: Choose from our various driving packages: Formula 4, Formula 1, WSR 3.5, or let yourself be tempted by a first drive in an Oreca FLM09. You can also bring your own car. We provide full FIA-standard equipment (overalls, gloves, helmet, HANS, shoes, balaclava, socks) to ensure the safety and comfort of every participant.
CorporateEvents.p4: You will be supervised by our mechanics and engineers, as well as by professional coaches who will give the briefings, observe the driving, and carry out a personalised debriefing, including an analysis of the videos and data. Finally, you can display your POS material on site for an event that reflects your image.

DrivingExperiences.title: Driving Experiences
DrivingExperiences.subtitle: BE A RACING DRIVER DURING THE DAY
DrivingExperiences.p1: With over 25 years' experience in Formula 1 driving courses, as well as 7 years' participation in the Formula 1 World Championship from 1986 to 1992, AGS is the ideal partner for an unforgettable experience!
DrivingExperiences.p2: From Formula 4 to Formula 1, come and discover how to drive a single-seater in complete safety. Briefings, provision of equipment, professional coaches... AGS takes care of everything!

DriverAcademy.title: Driver Academy
DriverAcademy.subtitle: LEVEL UP YOUR RACING TECHNIQUE
DriverAcademy.p1: We offer tailor-made driving courses, designed to help each young talent progress towards their competition goals. Whether it's a one-off session or a complete training programme, our expert coaches are with you every step of the way.
DriverAcademy.p2: Our mission: to reveal and develop your potential, while equipping you with the advanced technical skills to excel on the track. With personalised follow-up and detailed analyses, we help you to become an accomplished driver, ready to take on the challenges of the biggest circuits.
DriverAcademy.B1D: Our advanced training courses offer personalised sessions and tailor-made coaching workshops, adapted to the specific needs of each rider, such as braking. These targeted courses enable precise and effective technical development.
DriverAcademy.B2D: Our expert coaches accompany the drivers from start to finish, with detailed debriefings based on video analysis and technical data, ensuring continuous progress and optimised performance.
DriverAcademy.B3D: We make it a point of honour to identify and train new talent. Our courses are designed to reveal the potential of young drivers and prepare them for the challenges of professional racing.
DriverAcademy.B4D: We offer the possibility of privatising a days training or booking one on other circuits such as the Circuit Paul Ricard, the Circuit Club de Nevers Magny-Cours.

History.title: Our History
History.p1: AGS Formule 1 (Automobiles Gonfaronnaises Sportives) took part in the Formula 1 World Championships from 86 to 92, thanks to its founder Henri Julien. After these participations, he developed the concept of Formula 1 training courses. This was AGS's main activity for many years.
History.p2: The unique facilities of this former racing team based on the Côte d'Azur, and private access to the Var circuit, make it an exceptional setting for any motor sport activity.
History.p3: At the beginning of 2019, Willy Collignon, owner and manager of the First Motorsport stable, was looking for a second workshop in the south of France. After a long search, he ended up in Gonfaron... As soon as he entered the AGS facilities, he noticed the incredible potential of the team. He decided to invest in its development.
History.p4: Since August 2019, Willy has been at the helm of the team. His goal? To give AGS a fresh start and bring competition back to the workshop!
History.p5: He also wants to revive the history of AGS: we are rebuilding the historic vehicles that raced in the World Championship. Tarquini's JH25 and 24 have already taken to the track for the first time
History.p6: Do you want to be part of our history?

Racing.h1: Participate in a Race or Championship with AGS
Racing.p1: With our recognised experience and expertise, we offer you the opportunity to take part in some of the most prestigious championships and motor races.
Racing.p2: We are with you every step of the way, from the initial preparation to the finish line, making sure you have the best possible conditions to achieve your goals. Together, we make every race an unforgettable experience, where performance, passion and excellence meet.
Racing.B2P1: We offer you the best possible preparation!
Racing.B2P2: Driving Sessions on the circuit (Mainly the Circuit du Var)
Racing.B2P3: Full support from professional coaches, mechanics and engineers
Racing.B3P1: Transport to and from the vehicle(s)
Racing.B3P2: Presence of coaches, mechanics and engineers

Facilities.title: Facilities & Location
Facilities.p1: Located in a green setting in the heart of the Plaine des Maures, on the Circuit du Var, the AGS facilities allow us to enjoy the very best of motor sport!
Facilities.p1b2: Meeting rooms (equipped with TV, blackboard and projectors)
Facilities.p1b3: Drivers' changing room with showers Fleet of trucks, full assistance equipment
Facilities.f1p1: We restore and maintain historic racing cars.Thanks to its high-performance tools, AGS can also take care of a complete rebuild until the Historic Technical Passport is obtained and the car is entered in a competition.
Facilities.f1p2: We store your vehicles in a secure location. They will be ready for your driving sessions on the Var circuit (direct access to the track) and your competitions. It couldn't be simpler: everything happens in the same place!
Facilities.f2p1: On Driving Experience days, you can have lunch in the heart of our facilities. With two Formula 1 cars on display and a view of the circuit, it's the ideal place to spend a convivial moment before getting back behind the wheel.
Facilities.f3p1: The Circuit du Var used to be a test track for AGS Formula 1 cars. Today, it is mainly used for training courses and track days. A technical track that combines fast corners and twisty sections.
Facilities.f3b2: Private access to the track from AGS
Facilities.p2: Just a few kilometres from the French Riviera, AGS is located in the heart of the Maures mountains. Enjoy nature in all its forms... From vineyards to marinas and breathtaking views, the Var region offers you the best of the Mediterranean coast... Its central location means you can reach us in a number of ways.
Facilities.loc: 45 minutes away from St. Tropez, less than 2 hours from Monaco
Facilities.plane: 1 hour from Nice Côte d'Azur and Marseille Marignane airports, 40 minutes from Toulon airport + tourist airports nearby. Heliport on site.
Facilities.train: Les Arcs-Draguignan station (20 minutes by car).

Facilities.car2: From Aix en Provence, take the A8 motorway, then turn off onto the A57 towards Toulon. Immediately after the junction, take exit 13 (Le Cannet des Maures/Le Luc) onto the A57.
Facilities.car3: From Toulon, take the A57 towards Nice and take exit 13 (Le Cannet des Maures/Le Luc).
